reviews.review: O Melhor Jogo de Sempre

My fucking brain hurts after playing this game on a strait grind. I would recomend taking a few breaks before your brain becomes mush trying to figure out this story line. It is a really good game but the story fucks with your head especially in the last 30 minutes of the game.
优秀的剧情，一个很好的游戏

Sehr gutes Spiel mit einer [b]tollen Grafik[/b] (vor allem die sehr gelungenen Lichteffekte), einer [b]interessanten Story[/b] (mit vielen Wendungen), einem sehr guten Kampfsystem und der [b]Skyline + Skyhook[/b], die meiner Meinung die beiden genialsten Elemente des Spiels sind (Skyline fahren macht extrem viel Spaß).
Ist sein Geld auf jeden Fall wert.

Bioshock Infinite продолжает традиции первой игры: линейное прохождение, держащий в напряжении сюжет, преподносящий огромное количество загадок в течение всей игры, утопичный город как место действия, специальные возможности игрока, служащие разнообразием геймплея, а также шокирующая концовка, над которой еще пару дней потом раздумываешь. Но на этом сходства заканчиваются.
Вместо закрытого и вызывающего клаустрофобию подводного города – огромные пространства в небе. Чувство открытости не покидает нас даже в помещениях – локации стали ощутимо больше, есть, где развернуться.Это тот Bioshock который мы заслужили,возврат к корням серии преподносит Кена Левина как хорошего автора и гейм дизайнера.Игра проверенная временем.

Очень увлекательная игра которая проходится на одном дыхании, я бы сказал что это что-то на уровне ведьмака. Единственный минус это отсутствие ВЛИЯЮЩЕГО на сюжет выбора, уверен что было бы интереснее если бы концовка была не одна.

BioShock Infinite toma um rumo bem diferente dos clássicos da franquia. Este jogo foca menos no jumpscare e mais na história, trazendo uma relação forte de paternidade, multiverso e um final que irá te fazer pensar por horas. Para quem gosta de viagem no tempo, jogo de tiro em primeiro pessoa e multiverso, este é o jogo.
Nice Game !

BioShock Infinite - это когда уже прошла половина титров после концовки, а ты сидишь смотришь в одну точку, втыкаешь сюжет.
А если серьезно - потрясная игра, однозначно рекомендую всем, кто еще не играл.

[b]Bioshock Infinite[/b] is an amazing game. It builds off of the gameplay mechanics of the first two games perfectly but doesn't completely copy them. The weapons and gear are creative and satisfying to use. 

The story was amazing and tied the first two games in perfectly with Infinite's own story. 

I have two complaints. The game is a lot more linear than the first two games and it made you fight most of the enemies that were in your way. In the first two games you got to pick and choose a lot of your fights. 
[b]Note:[/b] This doesn't make it a bad game.

[b]In Conclusion;[/b] This is probably my favorite game of all time (maybe tied with the original Bioshock) and would recommend it to anyone who wants a non-arcade-like first person shooter and to anyone that likes half-life and the other Bioshocks.
Bioshock efsanesi için söylenecek bişey yok ki zaten . Hikaye desen efsane, Oynanış desen oyunun geçtiği zamanı tam olarak yansıtıyor. Daha ne olsunn ?

When I was done playing Bioshock, I'd assumed that we had a once in a decade game, and anything to come further would just be piloting off of a fluke. Bioshock 2 came along and my convictions seemed confirmed; and then this title's extremely high score was simply because of a level of funding that 2 didn't get, and I'd prepare for it to be not as great as what the 'bought reviews' might say, but still playing it out of respect to the original.

I was wrong. The score is justified. It took the original and it transcended.

There was a man, there was a game, there was a profound sense of satisfaction.

Эпичность зашкаливает.
Чем дальше проходишь игру, тем эпичнее битвы, тем эпичнее сюжет, тем эпичнее картинка перед глазами.
В конце хочу сказать, эта игра имеет самый сложный и один из самых крутых сюжетов ever.

I just wrote  massive review that didn't take somehow so I will keep this really simply:

Good: Fanastic world.  Gotta experience it.

Bad: Story is garbage and makes no sense. I can't stress this enough given the definite sense that it thinks so highly of itself.  Just stupid.
         Characters range from passable to just horribly written.  The worst written one is the protagonist who is a one dimensional dick.
         No replay. Short. Game mechanics make no sense from a design prespective and clash with themselves.

Still worth a buy, because the world offers something unique that you can't find in any other game.  Just manage your expectations and don't pay too much.

This is Bioshock Infinite from the perspective of a casual gamer. I may be in the minority here but I found this game underwhelming. Don't get me wrong I liked it but I didn't absolutely adore it like so many other reviewers. Here's why (spoiler free) :

1. Storyline: This has got to be the most story rich game I have ever played. However, don't be fooled it is 'story rich', doesn't mean that it's going to satiate you in any way. It's going to leave you thinking but not in the "man I need a joint and think about morality and life and spirituality" kind of way but rather the "wtf just happened, I need to wiki this shit right now" kind of way. This can be both a good and a bad thing depending on the kind of person you are. I for one am a bit impatient and want to be instantly gratified at the end of the game having persevered through it all.

2. Gameplay: They should probably have made a movie instead to do justice to this story. I  didn't enjoy the gameplay much. I felt that it was there just for the sake of progressing through the arc and nothing more. In FPS games I for one like to see attenention given to the array of weapons provided. I want to feel excited about unlocking a gun I really wanted or going through a challenging level all the while seeing my skill evolve. Sadly I didn't feel that about this game. The weapons were just there to take, the levels only involved walking a bit, a few random enemies, walk some more and just progress with the story. 

3. Replaybility:  As a logical corollory of the mediocre gameplay I don't forsee myself playing this game a lot in the future. Once you have beaten the game (especially in singleplayer FPS's) the thing that draws you to play again and again is the actual gameplay and that is for me a big disappointment here.

So all in all, your experience may vary greatly depending on what you look in a FPS. Are you here just for the story or does it take more to get you to keep coming back ? I still recommend this game it's narrative but not at this price point, wait for a Steam sale and then get the game.

Es una joya, apuntadlo para cuando este de oferta. 

Esto es lo que deberia ser un triple A y no las mierdas que nos intentan colar ultimamente. Me lo he pasado del tiron en un dia, empezando por la mañana tempranito, en nivel medio. Total unas 11-12 horas de un domingo. Lo compre hace tiempo por creo que 5 pavos y no veas que chollazo, lo tenia aparcado y me lamento solamente de no haberlo jugado antes, porque es una maravilla.

Puntuaciones:
Graficos personajes 8  (60 fps jugando en 1080p calidad ultra con ocasionales caidas de framerate en algunas zonas a 40-45fps)
Graficos entornos 8  (los escenarios estan muy logrados)
Musica 7
Jugabilidad 9
Dificultad 7 (salvo algun detalle dificil puntual, en general es un juego facil en el nivel medio, moriras algunas veces pero sin desesperarte)
IA enemigos 7 (decente tirando a buena, pero mejorable)
Historia 8 
Doblaje 8
Global 8

Es un shooter facilon, no necesitas ser un aguila disparando, la dificultad solo es notable en algunos jefecillos que hay que son un poco bestias y que no hay herramientas para curarse en combate a menos que a la chica que te acompaña le de por darte una curacion que solo lo hace cuando estas casi muerto (tambien te da balas cuando te quedan pocas pero nunca suficientes). Ademas de la vida, que no se regenera salvo con comida o botiquines, tienes un escudo de energia que se regenera con el tiempo. Gestionando bien la cobertura no tendras problemas con la mayoria de enemigos.
En cuanto a punteria y apuntado es como los primeros Call of Duty o Battlefield que la punteria era legendaria, aqui igual, apuntas desde la cadera y le das a la gente bien sin esfuerzo. Esta pensado en esta aspecto para mandos de consolas, se ve claramente, porque con el mando no se apunta con la misma precision y velocidad que con un raton bueno. Probe con el mando primero pero el movimiento de camara me mareaba un poco y al final lo he jugado con raton.

La dificultad estriba mayormente en la escasez pertinaz de municion que no se puede apenas ampliar la capacidad (82 disparos con carabina, 180 con pistola, 150 con ametralladora, etc...), ocasionales hordas de malos en algunos puntos del juego y algunos bichos elites que te vienen en algun momento y que cuestan de matar bastante, como el handy man o el tio ese que va ardiendo y carga hacia ti. Me han recordado algunos bichos un poco a los headless bombers del Serious Sam por lo de cargar hacia ti a saco como paco jejeje.
Los enemigos flanquean a poco que te quedes a cubierto un rato, tienen bastante buena punteria y aunque no son Guillermo Tell no puedes ir por ahi en plan rambo o duras mas bien poco, especialmente con los francotiradores que disparan muy bien. La IA de enemigos es bastante decente aunque las he visto mejores. Se ponen a cubierto un poco mal la verdad, no tan mal como en el Fallout 3 o 4 que se quedan con medio cuerpo a la vista los cantamañanas, pero vamos que no son ninjas tampoco, se les suele ver un poco la cabeza o un pie asomando y si apuntas bien les daras.

Hay un tramo al final del juego, como una hora o poco mas antes del final, que me han tenido literalmente media hora sin balas, he tenido que matar unos 25-30 tipos que te atacan a porrazos (afortunadamente no tienen pistolas) a golpes de melee, y por supuesto no tiraban balas para lotear, porque no llevan pistolas :P
Hay algunas luchas finales que lo mismo, la dificultad es mas tener balas disponibles para disparar que el propio enemigo en si. Solo te dejan usar dos armas asi que estas batante limitado tacticamente ya que si llevas un arma pesada tienen muy poca municion y no compensa mucho. Yo me lo he pasado con todo pistola y carabina y algo de ametralladora cuando me quedaba con pocas balas de lo otro.  Las balas de carabina casi nunca caen, te toca comprarlas y no veas lo poco que duran 82 balas en un rifle semiautomatico de disparo rapido. La escopeta me ha parecido un poco inutil como arma comparandola con las demas, tiene muy poca municion, 24 cartuchos o asi, y el daño es muy bajo para tener tan pocas balas, que necesitas 2 o 3 disparos para los enemigos normales y una jarta para los elites, que te queda sin cartuchos y siguen vivos, vamos. 

Con la salvedad de la escasez de balas y que solo se pueden usar dos armas a un mismo tiempo, para ser un juego de hace cinco años deja en mantillas a muchos juegos mas modernos que he jugado ultimamente. Las texturas son buenas y los movimientos de los personajes bastante fluidos. La ambientacion esta muy lograda y la historia es muy buena aunque me hubiera gustado algo mas larga, unas pocas horas mas.

Añadir que el doblaje al castellano es muy bueno. Normalmente me chirrian las voces y las traducciones de andar por casa que se ven a veces (Fallout 3 jugue dos horas cuando lo compre y lo aparque muchos meses porque no soportaba las voces de algunos personajes femeninos, me taladraban el alma). Si el doblaje es malo o mediocre prefiero el ingles  pero en este caso es una delicia tal y como lo han hecho, no he notado nada raro en las traducciones y los actores de voz lo hacen muy bien.

Recomendable 100%, sobre todo de oferta. Si le añadieran la posibilidad de usar una tercera arma equipada seria perfecto para compensar la poca municion que hay. Tendre que investigar a ver si hay algun mod.

A Masterpiece even in 2016.. because of its art style. Ending is mindblowing, gameplay is more refined, ambience and environments are straight out of a child storybook that makes me feel like a kid all over again. The characters are interesting, weapons are cool and customized ways to kill your opponents are fun. It holds itself really well against current gen shooters like Black Ops 3 and Battlefield 4 and Rainbow Six Siege because this game does not have graphics, it has an ART STYLE.. It is a painting. Really sad to see this franchise will not be continued anymore. 10/10 for me.

This is one of those rare games that checked each and every one of the boxes, filled you with awe and feels and made you want to give it not one, but the whole god damned gold star sheet, and forcing you to later return again and again to relive its splendor, and later return to write a steam store review in which you sound like a salesman.

Its just amazingly well crafted on all levels, from the gameplay mechanics, graphics, sound design and music, the writing, acting and production design. Its seamlessness and well-put-togetherness makes it feel like walking around in a living  disney film, if disney films portrayed anti-heroes who leads gory uprisings in a gruesomely failed american oligarch utopia ruled by american exeptionalism, racism, christianity and libertarianism.

The two dlc's, burial at the sea 1 and 2 elaborates the story and the feels from the main game and you will definitely not regret playing either one of them, even though I remember the first of the two as a bit weaker than the second.

I absolutley loved this game. I played the first Bioshock when it was first released, but for some reason I wasn't looking forward to Bioshock Infinite (a city in the sky? Ridculous). Because of that I didn't get it until about 18 months after release date.

After I played the game, I immediatley wish I bought it opening day. Although some opinions are mixed as to whether Infinite is better than the original Bioshock, I don't think anyone can argue that the game isn't an outstanding game in its own right.

Art / Graphics: 
The graphics and the art style are fantastic. I first played the game on a really crappy computer, so I actually had to play it on low settings at 800x600, and it was certainly playable mainly due to how vibrant the art style is. On my current computer I can play the game on Ultra, and it looks amazing for a game that came out a few years ago.

Gameplay:
Overall it's a pretty standard shooter. None of the weapons you get particularly stand out, but they are still fun to use. The Vigors (basically Plasmids from the first game) are fun to use and mess around with. They aren't necessary by any means, but if you heavily integrate them into your gameplay the game becames a breeze (difficulty wise).

The game doesn't have a lot of exploration; most areas are pretty straight forward, although I personally enjoyed that. There was enough to look for/look at without it feeling like I was wasting my time checking every corner or worrying that I missed something by not being thorough enough

Story:
The story and chracters are the main reason I love the game. The game did a great job at making you care about the main chracters, particularly Elizabeth. I was completley taken aback when I beat the game... I couldn't belive how amazing it was. After I beat it I immediatley scoured the internet to read eveyrone's interpretation and opinion on the story and ending.

All in all - if you like video games at all, you ow it to yourself to play Bioshock Infinite. It goes on sale frequently enough that there isn't much of an excuse to not pick it up.

One of the best, if no the best games I have ever played. The story is absolutely amazing and really well written. Everything about this game is just awesome.

What a game, what an experiance.
I bought this game on the summer sale because i've heard that it was good. But o'boy where they wrong. It's awesome!
When i started playing i was nailed to my chair, and could not stopp playing until i had finnished the entire game. And this was on a sunday and i had to get to work the next day, but it didn't matter. When the credits rolled i looked at my phone and saw it was 4:30 AM, and i had no regrets. It's a game thats not as much about the gameplay, for me atleast, but the story! The story (which im not going to spoil) is like Inception on steroids. Afterwords you just sit there like "Wow....  mind blown". They could defenitly make a movie out of it (please do that and only stick to the original story. DON'T change stuff just to be able to make a sequal). There is only one complaint i have with this game and that is, that the game is too short in my opinion. 8 hours is not enough for me, when i buy a game i want to be able to squeeze atleast 100+ hours out of it. But im getting of topic. To sum up my thoughts on whether you should buy this game or not; If you like the story element of your games it's defenitly worth it, especially if you get it discounted. If you are just looking for a game to breeze through and shoot stuff maybe it's not for you unless, again, you get it on a steam sale.
Overall a great game that i wished was longer. 
Thanks for reading through this giant wall of text, and i hope it helped you!
游戏实在太棒了，无论是剧情还是游戏性上都很新奇，也继承了前作的优点，剧情有些烧脑，是个凄美的故事。
Was gibt es hierzu überhaupt zu sagen? Der Kauf lohnt sich alleine wegen der Story (das Ende... das Ende...).
Awesome Game, Great Story

Боже мой, аж трясет, это повествоание- шедеврально)

It's a fantastic game, one of the best i've ever played, the plot is interesting and the gameplay is very nice, altough there are some defects. It's a must buy, do not wait and buy it.
the ending might be terrible, but the game itself is very pretty and fun to play.

How to describe Bioshock Infinite?
You could use thons of words but the most accurate ones would be innovative, fun and cry-inducing (that may be two words... well, the game itself is way too fantastic to be described with just one). At first you'll find yourself learning the controls, BUUUUUUUT you find your way through it easy enough. The game is filled with references to the past 112 years of human existence in this planet of ours and you can't thank it to it's plot.
The soundtrack is great, the story is fantastic, the characters (both DeWitt and Elizabeth) are great.

El Bioshock 1 lo jugué con un padrino y me gustó, El 2 tuve la oportunidad de comprarlo para la Xbox 360 y Me encantó la historia, Pues el infinite me estoy quedando sin palabras La jugabilidad 100/10, La historia 100/10, Los gráficos 100/10

Forget all other BioShocks, this is the one you want.
I bought the bundle, played the first one a little, but felt it was too dark and creepy. Skipped the second one and started playing this. 2 years later I return for a second playthrough and am again thoroughly enjoying myself. Just finished a 4-hour sitting. I just couldn't stop, but now I really have to get some sleep.

Get it on a sale, or for full price, these days it's not that expensive anymore.

I wanted it to continue, so I quit playing just before the final boss (I think). Now I started fresh and I'm definitely going to try to finish the story this time.

[h1]Finally finished after 13 hours. Mind = blown! Great ending![/h1]

A must play for anyone who likes a great immersive RPG/FPS with an absolutely beautiful cast of characters; from the brilliantly beautiful Elizabeth to the charasmatic and sometimes a bit of an asshole Booker Dewitt. I am still wanting more of this beautifully crafted masterpiece of a game!

BUY IT NOW!

Hay gente que odia este juego, pero a mi me parece una obra maestra. La jugabilidad es excelente y tiene mejoras con respecto a los anteriores BioShock, introduciendo los combates en los raíles, si bien podrían haber metido más de estos. La ambientación en Columbia es excelente, logrando superar incluso a Rapture, si bien algunos jugadores se han quejado de que Columbia no daba la impresión de ser una ciudad de verdad como Rapture. Probablemente esto se deba a la falta de libertad de movimientos: una vez superada una zona, no es posible volver atrás. Esto puede parecer malo, pero la gente se queja de vicio. Hay muchos FPS que no son mundo abierto y la gente los disfruta igual. Supongo que tener una ciudad como Columbia hace querer tener la libertad de disfrutarla como uno quiera, pero por el argumento, no tiene sentido que nuestro personaje pueda moverse libremente. De hecho eso es lo mejor del juego: el argumento. Para mí es sencillamente genial. Desde el comienzo pasan una serie de cosas extrañas. Uno puede ir escuchando grabaciones para saber más, y lo considero muy necesario, porque desvelan detalles esenciales, aunque en mi opinión ni escuchando todas las grabaciones uno está preparado para el final del juego. Sí, en este caso sólo hay un final, pero tiene sentido que sólo sea uno. ¡Y vaya final! No voy a soltar spoilers, por supuesto, pero es lo mejor que he visto y ha dado para infinidad de análisis en páginas y foros de videojuegos. En cierta forma la trama nos recuerda a series como Lost (Perdidos), pero afortunadamente en este caso todo queda mejor atado y explicado, incluso si hay diversas interpretaciones.

Aparte de la trama principal, es esencial el contexto de ésta: el primer BioShock era una bofetada al capitalismo salvaje, el segundo BioShock era una bofetada al marxismo-leninismo, y este es una bofetada al fascismo y el fanatismo religioso: Columbia en un primer momento parece idílica, pero en pocos minutos descubrimos su verdadera naturaleza: es una dictadura ultraconservadora y racista, dirigida por el Padre Comstock, donde los negros e irlandeses son considerados ciudadanos de segunda.

En cuanto al apartado técnico, como he dicho Columbia es espectacular, pero hay que resaltar también al personaje de Elizabeth, con una animación excelente.

El juego cuenta con dos DLC: Burial at Sea, partes 1 y 2, ambientados en Rapture en vez de Columbia, aunque enlazados con la trama principal de ésta última, y son interesantes.

Finalmente, decir que si eres un experto en FPS, debes ir sin duda a por el logro de completar el juego en el Modo 1999 sin comprar nada en las máquinas expendedoras Dollar Bill. La primera zona puede hacerse un infierno (tardé una tarde entera en completarla), pero una vez superada empiezas a conseguir mejoras y la dificultad ya no es desesperante. El Modo 1999 está disponible si completas primero el juego en otro nivel de dificultad o si introduces el código de Konami en la pantalla de título.

Pochi giochi mi hanno emozionato come questo capitolo. L'ambientazione, i personaggi, la storia, e sopratutto il finale. Uno dei finali più tristi ed emozionanti che abbia visto fin ora. 
Il tutto non esalta nessun particolare difetto se non la scarsa  originalità del gameplay, ma elemento tranquillamente trascurabile vista la perfezione di tutto il resto.

BEFORE I START I WANNA SAY I CAN RUN THIS GAME ON HIGH GRAPHICS WITH 30 - 45 FRAMES NO PROBLEM ON A CRAPTOP AND BE BLOWN AWAY, EXTREMELY WELL BUILT AND HIGHLY OPTIMIZED. I HAVE AN A6 AMD and 4 GIGS OF RAM LENOVO G50.

This is one of the best games I've played in my entire life. 
You start on a boat with two quirky rowers taking you to a tower, the setting is very stormy and dark. You arrive to an island with a lighthouse and a note on the door telling you to pay your debts and bring the girl. Walk up and find a dead guy and 2 mintes later end up in a pre-heaven full of corruption and racism. The scenery is epic and the graphics are above excellent. The story absorbs you and you don't wanna leave. The enemies make my heart pump and I have to strategize how I use my Salts (Powers and such, which are also amazing). It's not run and gun and it's defenitly emerssive.
 

I have 9 hours as of writing this and I must say that it's one of those games where you say, " I'm just gonna go find this gunsmith dude and after that I'll go have a smoke" 2 hours later.. "I'm gonna kill this Comstock dude and go have a smoke" Neck hurts, Eyes hurt, 5 missed calls and 2 voicemails later " Jesus this is a great game, I'm gonna go have a smoke"

YOU WILL NOT REGRET I SWEAR TO ALLAH AND JESUS AND EVERY OTHER MYTHICAL FIGURE
